parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear flange bearing can cause the rear wheel to malfunction, leading to loss of control and potential accidents.
symptoms: The rear flange bearing comes apart

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Uneven tire wear can lead to loss of traction, reduced handling, and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: with significant differences in tread depth between the left and right sides.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The front end wobble can cause loss of control, reduced stability, and increased risk of accidents, especially at speeds between 38-50 mph.
symptoms: The front end of the motorcycle wobbles or shakes
causing the handlebars to vibrate or move from side to side
often accompanied by a feeling of instability or loss of control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The front end popping or bumping can cause loss of control, reduced stability, and increased risk of accidents, especially when encountering bumps or potholes.
symptoms: The front end of the motorcycle pops or bumps when going over bumps or potholes
causing a loss of traction and stability.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An inaccurate speedometer reading can lead to safety concerns, as riders may be driving at unsafe speeds, potentially causing accidents or near-misses. Additionally, this can lead to legal liability issues and increased stress while driving.
symptoms: The speedometer reads 8-10% higher than the actual speed
causing riders to unintentionally drive at slower speeds than indicated
and flashing lights from other drivers.
